events.event_description: Orsted canceled the 2,400-MW Ocean Wind 1 and 2 projects in New Jersey due to rising interest rates, high inflation, and supply chain delays.
events.citation: In late 2023, developer Orsted canceled the 2,400-MW Ocean Wind 1 and 2 projects in New Jersey, citing rising interest rates, high inflation, and supply chain delays.

events.event_description: The South Fork Wind project with 12 turbines began generating electricity but awaits commercial operation.
events.citation: The 130-MW South Fork Wind project is awaiting commercial operation. It consists of 12 turbines located off the coast of Long Island, New York. The project began generating electricity in March

events.event_description: Vineyard Wind 1 project reports 10 of 62 planned turbines installed offshore of Martha's Vineyard.
events.citation: Of the 62 turbines, 10 were in place as of this past February according to the project's co-owner Avangrid.

events.event_description: Orsted and Eversource began construction of monopile foundations for the 704-MW Revolution Wind project.
events.citation: This past spring, developers Orsted and Eversource started building the vertical cylinders known as monopiles to support wind turbines at the 704-MW Revolution Wind project located offshore of Rhode Island.

events.event_description: Dominion Energy installed first monopile for the 1,265-MW Coastal Virginia Offshore Wind Commercial Project.
events.citation: In May, Dominion Energy built the first monopile at the 1,265-MW Coastal Virginia Offshore Wind (CVOW) Commercial Project.

events.event_description: Orsted withdrew from commitments to build the Skipjack 1 and 2 projects totaling 966 MW, while continuing development and permitting.
events.citation: In January, Orsted withdrew from commitments to the Maryland Public Service Commission to build the Skipjack 1 and 2 projects, totaling 966 MW, but is still continuing with advanced development and permitting.

events.event_description: The 20-MW Icebreaker Wind project on Lake Erie was halted due to rising costs and loss of funding.
events.citation: Late last year, the developer of the 20-MW Icebreaker Wind project on the Ohio coast of Lake Erie halted the project amid rising costs and loss of funding.
